content.description:
Est procul in pelagopelagus, -i, m. = mare, -is saxum spumantiaspumo, -are: to foam contra 
litora, quod tumidistumidus, -a, -um, adj.: swollen summersumsummergo, -ere, -mersi, -mersum: to submerge tunditurtundo, -ere = pello, -ere olim 
fluctibus.
content.question: In the sentence, Est procul in pelago saxum spumantia contra litora is translated

choices.label: There is a rock far off in the sea opposite the foaming shore
The rocks far off against the shore are foaming in the sea
There is a shore foaming against rocks in the far off sea
In the foaming sea is a far off rock opposite the shore

content.answer: There is a rock far off in the sea opposite the foaming shore

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
